alert.note: Alert for St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 9:54AM CST until February 01 at 9:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tickfaw River at Liverpool affecting St. Helena Parish. For the Tickfaw River...including Liverpool, Holden, Killian, Montpelier...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tickfaw River at Liverpool. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Pastures and crop land adjacent to the river will flood. Rural areas near the river will be threatened with flooding. At 11.0 feet, Low lying roads and buildings near the river along with pasture and crop land will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CST Monday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 10.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 09/16/1971. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
